(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Deserialization DoS] Does try_from_bytes() properly validate input size limits before calling bcs::from_bytes(), or can an attacker provide extremely large byte arrays that exhaust memory during deserialization and cause validator node crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Type confusion] Can try_from_bytes() be exploited by providing BCS bytes that deserialize into a valid DepositEvent structure but with malformed internal data that violates invariants when accessed by amount() getter? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Error handling bypass] Does the error propagation in try_from_bytes() using map_err(Into::into) properly preserve all error context, or can attackers exploit silent error conversion to bypass validation checks in calling code? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [BCS version mismatch] Can an attacker exploit differences in BCS serialization versions by crafting bytes that deserialize differently across validator nodes running different BCS library versions, causing state divergence? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Malformed BCS structure] Does try_from_bytes() validate that the deserialized struct contains exactly one u64 field, or can extra trailing bytes in the input be silently ignored, allowing event data manipulation? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Panic on invalid input] Can specially crafted invalid BCS bytes cause bcs::from_bytes() to panic instead of returning an error, potentially crashing validator nodes during event processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [Race condition in deserialization] If multiple threads call try_from_bytes() concurrently on shared byte slices, can race conditions in BCS deserialization lead to corrupted DepositEvent instances? [File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/deposit_event.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer validation] Does new(amount: u64) validate that amount is not zero or u64::MAX, or can attackers create DepositEvents with extreme values that cause arithmetic overflow in downstream processing? (High)
